intro: Microsteira ambovombensis, commonly known as the Madagascar microsteira, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is a small shrub characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
